intro: Helichrysum pseudofasciculatum, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and produces small, yellow to golden-orange flowers that are often arranged in clusters. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its drought tolerance. Helichrysum pseudofasciculatum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
